articles.Title: Geoffrey Hinton talks about Deep Learning, Google and Everything
Weekend Read: Big Data Is Changing, and Itâs the Cloudâs Fault
articles.Description: DAVID COHEN:Â The shift to the cloud is throwing a new wrench into the equation and offering up new opportunities to innovate.Â Companies are rapidly replacing on-premise software with cloud-based equivalents to reduce costs and serve the needs of a distributed workforce. At the same time, weâre seeing individuals and teams within organizations adopt new services without going through IT, just as we saw with BYOD in years past.Â Suddenly, companies are discovering that the small number of data sources they previously had to contend with have been replaced with dozens or even hundreds of cloud services, many of which are used by only a small percentage of their workforce. The result is that the traditional, centralized data architectures -- and the processes built to support them -- simply canât keep up. ...

articles.Title: Spotify Predicts Armageddon, But Big Data Will Struggle To Find Pop Music's Next Breakout Hit
articles.Description: It's a Monday morning, and I'm quietly giggling away at one of the latest examples of big data being used to highlight human nature. Thanks to a somewhat tongue-in-cheek question from a Twitter user to Spotify's data team, it turns out that Spotify's user base spiked the listens of one particular bombastic track from one particular over-the-top Michael Bay film.
